case_vignette: A 20-year-old college student comes to the physician because she has been extremely sad for the past 3 weeks and has to cry constantly. Three weeks ago, her boyfriend left her after they were together for 4 years. She has no appetite and has had a 2.3-kg (5.1-lb) weight loss. She has missed several classes because she could not stop crying or get out of bed. She thinks about her ex-boyfriend all the time. She says that she experienced similar symptoms for about 2 months after previous relationships ended. The patient is 158 cm (5 ft 2 in) tall and weighs 45 kg (100 lb); BMI is 18 kg/m2. Her temperature is 36.1°C (97°F), pulse is 65/min, and blood pressure is 110/60 mm Hg. Physical examination shows no abnormalities. On mental status examination she appears sad and cries easily.
question: Which  is the most likely diagnosis?

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask simple 1 line questions, one question at a time. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. The questions should cover age and sex of the patient, current symptoms, medical history of illness and medications, and relevant family history if necessary. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I've been extremely sad, constantly crying for the past 3 weeks, and I've lost my appetite, resulting in some weight loss.
Do you have any difficulty sleeping or do you find yourself sleeping too much?
I didn't mention anything about my sleep, just that I couldn't get out of bed to attend my classes.
Have you experienced any significant life changes or stressors recently?
Yes, my boyfriend left me three weeks ago after a 4-year relationship.
Have you had any thoughts of harming yourself or thoughts of death?
I haven't mentioned having any thoughts of harming myself or thoughts of death.
I apologize for making any assumptions. May I ask, do you have a history of depression or any other mental health issues?
I experienced similar symptoms for about 2 months after past relationships ended.
Have you been using any medications or substances to cope with your feelings?
I haven't mentioned using any medications or substances to cope with my feelings.
Do you have a history of mental illness in your family?
I didn't mention anything about my family's history of mental illness.
I apologize for the oversight. Are you experiencing any other physical symptoms, like changes in your energy levels, concentration, or daily functioning?
I've missed several classes because I couldn't stop crying or get out of bed.
Have you had episodes like this one before your recent breakup, unrelated to life events?
No, the only other times I experienced similar symptoms were after previous relationships ended.
**Final Diagnosis:** Adjustment Disorder with Depressed Mood.
